title: Real Housewives' Danielle Staub promises to spill secrets about Teresa Giudice

text:
Teresa Giudice was just released in December after a year behind bars because of fraud charges and has a new book to promote: Turning The Tables: From Housewife to Inmate And Back Again.
But she's not the only Bravo beauty active in the book business.
On Thursday it was revealed her former Real Housewives Of New Jersey cast mate Danielle Staub, 53, is penning a tell-all book.
Scroll down for video
Her turn to talk: On Thursday it was revealed her former Real Housewives Of New Jersey cast mate Danielle Staub, 53, is penning a tell-all book; here she is seen in 2014
'I’m breaking my silence,' the former bad girl of Bravo tweeted.
The TV personality, who is known for fighting with Teresa on the series, added: 'And writing my tell all including the "Reality of #RHONJ" the impact on mine and my family's life's @Andy @bravotv.'
It is not known why she singled out both Bravo and Andy Cohen in her tweet, but left off the names of the cast members she feuded with, including Jacqueline Laurita and Caroline Manzo.
She did not mix well: Staub was invited on the series by Laurita, but did not get along with the other ladies. She often took pot shots at Teresa and was involved in the infamous scene where Giudice flipped a table in a restaurant that aired in 2009; here is a cast shot from season one
Her words: 'I’m breaking my silence,' the former bad girl of Bravo tweeted. The beauty, who is known for fighting with Teresa on the series, added: 'And writing my tell all including the "Reality of #RHONJ" the impact on mine and my family's life's @Andy @bravotv'
Staub was invited on the series by Laurita, but did not get along with the other ladies.
She often took pot shots at Teresa and was involved in the infamous scene where Giudice flipped a table in a restaurant that aired in 2009.
Then there was the time when Danielle got her hair pulled by Laurita’s daughter Ashley.
Danielle, a mother of two, left the franchise in 2012 after just two seasons.
At the time, she told UsWeekly, 'I'm way too good for this. They have used me about as much as I can be used.'
But everyone can't get enough of... : Teresa has landed her first interview with Good Morning America. The interview has been done already with Amy Robach. It took place in Giudice's Montville Township mansion and will air on February 9,
This is not Staub's first book.
In 2010 she came out with The Naked Truth: The Real Story Behind the Real Housewife of New Jersey - In Her Own Words that covered her alleged criminal past that was highlighted in the book Cop Without A Badge.
According to amazon.com, the book is 'fraught with tragedy and heartache, low-lifes and high society.
'From living the good life as a model in Miami, spending a stint in the Big House after getting mixed up with mobsters and the FBI, stripping and fighting for her life in New York, to finally settling down in New Jersey with her daughters, Danielle thought she had already seen it all, but in reality, her second act was just beginning.'
Their drama: Giudice finishes her sentence on February 5, although she was released into home detention just before Christmas. Husband Joe reports to the Federal Correctional Institution at Fort Dix in March to serve his 41-month sentence; here they are seen at court in 2014
Meanwhile, Teresa has landed her first interview with Good Morning America.
The interview has been done already with Amy Robach.
It took place in Giudice's Montville Township mansion and will air on February 9, the same day her memoir Turning The Tables: From Housewife to Inmate And Back Again is released.
Giudice finishes her sentence on February 5, although she was released into home detention just before Christmas.
